titles.title: California Ocean Sanctuary Act of 1987
A bill to prohibit the burning and dumping of toxic and hazardous waste in certain areas off the coast of California, and various other purposes.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

bill.summary: 3/31/1987--Introduced. California Ocean Sanctuary Act of 1987 - Designates a specified area of the Outer Continental Shelf extending 200 miles seaward from the seaward boundary of California as the California Ocean Sanctuary, prohibiting the ocean dumping or incineration of toxic or hazardous waste within the Sanctuary. Prohibits the exploration for fossil fuels, including oil and gas leasing, in specified areas in the Sanctuary.
